events.name: CSSConf.Asia 2016
events.description: Bridging web design and implementation. The front-end and UX conference for Southeast Asia

events.name: lets meet up and talk about latest trends in CIAM and typical challenges
events.description: As we kick off with first meet up for this group, we will talk about the latest trends in CIAM and typical challenges. We will have an open forum to hear from the group on how they see the adoption of CIAM in Singapore.
events.location: Molly Malone's Irish Pub, 56 Circular Road, Singapore

events.name: Singapore SQL PASS Chapter - November 2016 Meetup
events.description: Dear All, Its meetup time again at Singapore SQL PASS Chapter.  Please refer below for the details. Agenda: November 24th - 6:45 PM to 7 PM - Registration and Snacks 7 PM to 8 PM - Topic 1 - Presentation by Andreas Wolter 8:00 PM to 8:15 - Break 8:15 PM to 9:00 - Topic 2 - Presentation by Nagaraj Venkatesan Location: Microsoft Office, One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium Topic 1:  “SQL Server Attacked” – excerpts from “Hacking SQL Server from inside & outside” Synopsis: Join us in this November’s special: Andreas Wolter will give a “best of” of his various “Hacking SQL Server” sessions, covering attacks from inside as well as from outside. While a part will be demonstrated using SQL Injection, other small demos will demonstrate security traps and holes that can occur when mixing Development & Production and granting external personnel too many permissions. Speaker Profile: Andreas Wolter Andreas Wolter(Facebook | LinkedIn) has over 16 years of experience with SQL Server and earned the Master-Certification both on SQL Server 2008 (MCM) and SQL Server 2012 (MCSM)– as one of only 2 experts worldwide. Besides that he has also been awarded with the MVP for SQL Server since 2014.He is the founder of Sarpedon Quality Lab, originally from Germany, specializing in Development and Optimization of SQL Server Database- and Datawarehouse-architectures with focus on performance, scalability and security. Topic 2: SQL Server 2016 SP 1 - a Rocking Release!!! Synopsis: SQL Server 2016 Service Pack 1 was announced on Nov 17th and unlike any other usual service pack release, it had several path breaking changes announced. The big one of them being a major list of Enterprise features being made available on Standard edition. This session will discuss the features that moved to standard and how the applications can benifit using the same. The session will also cover few other useful enhancments that were released in SP1 Speaker Profile: Nagaraj Venkatesan Nagaraj Venkatesan, a SQL Server enthusiast exploring SQL Server for the last 10 years. Working for NCS Pte Ltd as SQL Server DBA, Nagaraj maintains databases used by one of the busiest public facing applications in the city. He frequently blogs at strictlysql.blogspot.com and is a regular contributor sqlservercentral.com. Besides these, he also holds a Masters Degree in Computing from National University of Singapore
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989

events.name: talk.js - DevFest.Asia 2016 Special Edition
events.description:
Highlights 7.00pm: Doors open - mingle over pizzas and drinks 7.30pm: Start of session, opening address by hosts 7.40pm: Start of scheduled talks 8.45pm: Open mic announcements 9.00pm: End of event 


Scheduled talks - Paws on Progressive Web Apps by Hemanth - Serverless AWS JavaScript Apps by Kai Hendry - JavaScript in the Enterprise by Ashwin Vombatkere - How (not) to Build an Augmented Reality App in 3 Weeks by Zhang Yi Jiang 


Misc If you have events, job opportunities, or something else you'd like to share with the audience, do so during open mic announcement. Bring along a photo ID to get through building security. Sponsor(s) Venue sponsor: PayPal Food and drink sponsor: PayPal
events.location: PayPal Singapore, Suntec Tower 5, 5 Temasek Boulevard #09-01

events.name: CSSConf.Asia 2016 x Code In The Dark Afterparty!
events.description:
This year's CSSConf.Asia Afterparty promises to be AWESOME.

Test how good your HTML and CSS skills really are: Recreate a website from scratch in front of our entire audience and win amazing prizes! 

Big thanks to Braintree for supporting us in bringing you this great After-Party event for all our CSSConf.Asia and JSConf.Asia attendees!
events.location: Canvas Club, 20 Upper Circular Road, The Riverwalk, #B1-01/06, Singapore 058416

events.name: GTT1116:  User Growth needs User Trust
events.description:
Introduction: Embark on the journey with Grab’s User Trust team to find out how they uncover suspicious activities of users and combat fraud on Grab’s platform using a wide range of techniques from heuristics methods to machine learning models. Talks will be accessible to all levels: we welcome beginner and expert data scientists or engineers alike on Thursday 24th November 2016.  Presenter Profile:  Yuda Zhao is a data scientist in the User Trust team. He has built models for detecting fraudulent behaviours in cashless transactions as well as in GrabHitch rides. In his personal life, he likes to play competitive board games and video games. 


 Li Yun Sim looks into the policies in User Trust team from different angles - ranging from data to ops. She enjoys reading and watching movies in her free time. 



Format: Two (2) short Presentations and a demo followed by ~20 minutes of audience Q&A for a total of ~one and a half (1.5) hours.  Agenda: Our agenda for the evening should be as follows: • 7:00pm - Registration opens • 7:10pm - Happy Hour Networking with Bites • 7:20pm - Welcome Remarks & Presenter Introductions • 7:30pm - Li Yun Sim on User Trust - To trust or not to trust, that is the question Part 1 • 8:00pm - Yuda Zhao on User Trust - To trust of not to trust, that is the question Part 2 • 8:30pm - Audience Q&A • 9:10pm - More Drinks, Bites & Networking • 10:00pm - The End  Note Please RSVP here first and tell us your dietary restrictions if any, so that we can better prepare the food and drinks for optimal merry making.  About Grab Tech Thursdays: Grab Tech Thursdays is a monthly series for peers in Asia's tech startup community to share knowledge and best practices as well as provide an informal space to network. Originally conceived within Grab to focus on pushing the boundaries of technology and business to Drive Southeast Asia Forward, we are excited to now make available these sessions on the last Thursday of each month to the wider tech/startup community. Stay tuned and check back for our line-up of interesting speakers and content.
events.location: Grab, 138 Cecil Street, #01-01 Cecil Court, Singapore 069538
